value.title: Computer chips that can read our brains have moved from sci-fi to reality, for better and worse
value.excerpt: The near-term applications will mostly benefit society, but the danger of a dystopian future is becoming more real, too.

value.title: Swyg raises $1.2M pre-seed to use peer-interviewers and AI to reduce bias in recruitment
value.excerpt: Swyg, a Dublin-based startup that believes it can reduce bias in recruitment by combining a peer-interview process with its own AI, has picked up $1.2 million in pre-seed funding. Leading the round is Frontline Ventures,

value.title: Inside Politics: Boris Johnson unveils government’s law-breaking bill
value.excerpt: What about the latest of Boris Johnson’s semi-regular political earthquakes? There’s plenty of spilled milk to cry over as his government introduces a new bill to override the withdrawal agreement today – the one that breaks international law.

value.title: 3 Ways AI Will Continue To Accelerate The Transition To Remote Work
value.excerpt: In response to the Covid-19 pandemic, businesses of all shapes and sizes have had to quickly adapt to remote work. Many experts predict that this year’s rapid transition to remote work constitutes a point of no return.

value.title: Nvidia RTX 3090, 3080, 3070 GPU: Price, Release Date, And Specs Detailed
value.excerpt: Nvidia revealed its new RTX 3000 line of Ampere-powered GPU earlier in the month--the RTX 3090, 3080, and 3070 cards. The new 3000 series is the second generation of RTX graphics cards that will run features like real-time ray tracing with much higher performance than current RTX cards.

value.title: Creating a sophisticated conversational experience using Amazon Lex in Australian English
value.excerpt: Amazon Lex is a service for building conversational interfaces into any application using voice and text. To build truly engaging conversational experiences, you need high quality speech recognition and natural language understanding that understands the intent of the customer accurately. We are excited

value.title: What Do The Server Quarterly Earnings Tell Us?
value.excerpt: As one could probably tell from my opening statement, I'm not, nor do I pretend to be a financial analyst. My lens on quarterly financials is that of a techie with interest. But, I do believe that following the individual company's earnings and PowerPoint slides used to drive earnings calls can tell a lot about that company's focus.

value.title: Sea-Tac Airport rolls out self-driving floor cleaners, restroom stall lights and more pandemic safety tech
value.excerpt: In addition to the thousands of gallons of hand sanitizer being dispensed around Seattle-Tacoma International Airport, the Port of Seattle is turning to a few new high-tech approaches to cleaning

value.title: Meet The AI Entrepreneur Preparing Underserved Students For The Future Of Work
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence is dramatically changing how we live and work. Ora D. Tanner is designing a tech-enabled AI curriculum for underserved high schoolers to help them succeed in our increasingly automated future.

value.title: CBP doesn’t consistently notify air travelers about facial recognition tech use, privacy: GAO
value.excerpt: Customs and Border Protection (CBP) is not consistently notifying travelers about its use of facial recognition technology or privacy options in US airports, according to the Government Accountability Office (GAO).

value.title: Nutanix joins Microsoft Azure for seamless Hybrid Cloud experience
value.excerpt: Enterprise Cloud computing firm Nutanix on Tuesday announced a partnership with Microsoft to deliver a Hybrid Cloud solution with seamless application, data and license mobility.

value.title: Tackling one of the biggest single sources of CO2 emissions with machine learning
value.excerpt: The 6 million buildings in the U.S. produce 40% of the country’s emissions, mostly from day-to-day lighting, heating, cooling, and appliance operation.

value.title: The Guardian’s GPT-3-generated article is everything wrong with AI media hype
value.excerpt: The Guardian today published an article purportedly written "entirely" by OpenAI's GPT-3. But the the newspaper's grand claims aren't all they seem.

value.title: United Imaging Announces Research Collaboration with Massachusetts General Hospital Using Artificial Intelligence to Fight COVID-19
value.excerpt: United Imaging, a global leader in advanced medical imaging and radiotherapy equipment, announced today that its artificial intelligence (AI) teams in Boston and Shanghai will collaborate with Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) to continue fighting COVID-19.

value.title: 5 surprising companies that have AI departments
value.excerpt: Sponsored Jobs Are you dreaming of starting an exciting career in AI? Most of the world’s tech giants are in a race to become the world’s leaders in artificial intelligence at the moment, making it an extremely competitive industry to get into.

value.title: Consumer Reports Unmasks Tesla’s Full Self-Driving Mystique, Here’s The Upshot
value.excerpt: For those that are already versed in self-driving tech, the assessment by CR is a welcome voice that adds more weight to the ongoing qualm by most such experts concerning Tesla and Elon Musk overpromising on what their so-called Full Self-Driving can currently do (see more at this link here ).

value.title: Artificial Intelligence Can Improve Process Management In Construction
value.excerpt: Construction has reasons, from safety to high cost and more, to be a slower adopter of technologies. What is shown is that artificial intelligence can help the industry and is beginning to make inroads.

value.title: Transforming Accounting With Artificial Intelligence: An Interview With Eli Fathi, CEO Mindbridge.ai
value.excerpt: This blog discusses why the accounting profession is undergoing major changes as a result of AI technologies. An example of a World Economic Forum Winner in the Top 100 2020, Mindbridge.ai is profiled due to their leadership in enabling auditors to to improve forensic accounting practices.

value.title: Tech startup uses machine learning to help workers learn new skills
value.excerpt: The coronavirus crisis has accelerated the need for workers to reskill. EmPath is a skills intelligence startup that uses artificial intelligence to offer companies insights into their workforce to ease upskilling and redeployment.

value.title: Facebook is working on AR glasses with a focus on audio clarity
value.excerpt: Facebook's Reality Labs Research wing is currently working on a number of projects designed to help us cut through noisy environments and zero in on folks we're trying to hold a conversation with, or enhance our daily lives when used with AR glasses.

value.title: Rethinking AI Ethics - Asimov has a lot to answer for
value.excerpt: Is the current obsession with AI Ethics doing any good? Maybe Asimov's Three Laws of Robotics wasn't such a great starting point after all
